text:
NABERS Waste Rules and support
documentation

12 Nov 2024

On this page

What's new in this version?
NABERS Rules

Other documents

Previous versions now superseded
About the NABERS Waste Platform
Who can use the Waste Platform?
Why our data format?

Using the online Waste Platform

Training

 

A NABERS Waste Verification is an independent measure of the resource recovery performance
of a building. It uses a consistent method of measurement to assess how well buildings separate
and divert waste generated on-site into streams that can be readily recovered, and whether
those materials are likely to go to a facility that will recover them efficiently. A NABERS Waste
Rating uses the same rigorous process to evaluate a building’s performance and then expresses
it on a star rating scale according to an industry benchmark. This lets you see how your

building compares to its peers of a similar building type.

The NABERS Waste Rules set out the requirements to assess the waste management and

resource recovery performance of any building type.

NABERS Waste Ratings or Verifications must be performed by a NABERS Assessor accredited
in the NABERS Waste methodology and comply with the principles and standards set in the

rules for gathering, interpreting, and using waste data.

The latest version of the NABERS Waste Rules is v2.1.

What's new in this version?

The Waste Rules v2.1 contains technical changes from v2.0 of the Rules.
All changes are itemised in Appendix G for easy reference, but in general:

e Manual handling (i.e. bag-based) data, previously accepted as primary data, is no longer

considered suitable for extrapolating building-wide results.

e Dry waste recycling now requires both a general waste and organics recycling stream
(where available) to be present and functional to properly account for putrescible material

and contamination.

The Rules - Waste for Offices v1.1 contains technical changes from v1.0. All changes are

itemised in Appendix G for easy reference, but in general:

e Manual handling (i.e. bag-based) data, previously accepted as primary data, is no longer

considered suitable for extrapolating building-wide results.

If you have any questions regarding the interpretation or application of the Rules, please

contact nabers@environment.nsw.gov.au.

Rules- Waste for Offices (January 2024)

About the NABERS Waste Platform

The NABERS Waste Platform is an online data management system designed to monitor waste

 

and recycling data. Its primary purpose is to facilitate the NABERS Waste Rating and

Verification process by securely storing the necessary information.

Additionally, it functions independently as a valuable tool for tracking waste and recycling.
The Platform offers the ability to gain valuable insights into waste management practices,

presenting dynamic charts and high-level indicators for a comprehensive overview.

The Platform can used across most of the built environment. Almost all property types are
already available and we will add additional as the demand increases. All user support
documents for the Platform can be found on this page. This includes the current version of the

data upload template for the Platform.

The free training module, NABERS Waste Basics provides an introduction to the NABERS
Waste Rating methodology and online platform for customers and users. We recommend for
users to upload their waste data on a regular basis to track, visualise and examine their ongoing

waste performance.

Who can use the Waste Platform?

Anyone with a valid NABERS login and password can use the Waste Platform.

If you are new to the Platform, then we recommend you complete our free online training.

Why our data format?

NABERS worked with the commercial property sector to develop a national standard waste
reporting format. These reports allow waste producers to become more consistent across the

sector which makes it easier to benchmark waste performance improvements.

This format is becoming a national standard for the collection of commercial waste data. The

format:

e meets the needs of the Better Buildings Partnerships Operational Waste Guidelines;
e can be used for Green Star points through the Green Building Council of Australia; and

e aligns with the waste industry’s move towards actual-weight-based reporting

By delivering waste data in this format, you will be offering your clients best practice reporting.

Using the online Waste Platform

The Waste Platform can be configured to enable an organisation’s cleaning or waste contractor
to upload their nightly collection data on a regular basis, using the Waste Platform Data

Template below.
An organisation can also assign a Platform Administrator to carry out this task themselves.

Alternately, they can find an assessor to manage the entire process on their behalf. There are
numerous specialised waste consultants among our list of accredited assessors who can provide

this assistance.

The organisation can view and use this data for ongoing management of their operational waste

performance, and to generate a NABERS Waste Rating or Verification.

NABERS offers a free online tutorial on how to use the platform, called NABERS Waste Basics.

This training will give you:

e an overall understanding of how the Platform works;
e detail on how to upload data to the Platform;

e an understanding of how organisations will view and use the data; and

e the skills to troubleshoot data upload issues.

The tutorial is designed to be self-paced and modular, making it a handy resource for ongoing

reference or sharing with others as needed.

You can access the tutorial by following this link or by navigating to the training page of this

 

 

website and searching for “waste.”
